member.name: T:Juhta.Net.Common.ObjectFactory
member.summary: A static class that provides services for creating instances of such classes whose type is not directly referencable in the current programming context. A typical scenario for using this class is to create instances of classes that are not available at the build time but are known to implement a specific interface.

member.name: M:Juhta.Net.Common.ObjectFactory.CreateInstance``1(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of a specified class by using the default constructor.
member.typeparam: Specifies a type for the return value. An instance to create must be castable to this type.
member.param: Specifies an Assembly object.

Specifies an assembly class name. The value can begin with a '.' character in which case the root namespace for the class will be taken from the file name part of the Assembly object's Location property.
member.returns: Returns the created instance casted to the requested type.

Specifies an array of parameters that will be passed to the appropriate constructor. Can be null causing the default constructor to be called.
member.returns: Returns the created instance casted to the requested type.

member.summary: Represents a first-in, first-out queue for a generic object type. The queue implemented by this class is thread-safe, and it also blocks readers in case of an empty queue. This queue has especially been designed to act as a work queue in multi-threaded applications.

member.summary: Closes the object queue specified by this ObjectQueue instance. The operation releases all threads that are blocked by the current instance.

member.summary: Gets the next object from the object queue specified by this ObjectQueue instance.
member.returns: Returns the next instance of T from the queue. The return value is null only, if the queue was initially empty and the queue had been closed prior to the call or no object became available before the queue was closed during the call.

member.name: M:Juhta.Net.Common.Utf8FileWriter.Open
member.summary: Opens the underlying UTF8-encoded file.

remarks.para: This method does nothing if the underlying UTF8-encoded file is already open.

This method does not necessarily have to be called when writing data to the underlying UTF8-encoded file. If the file is not open, it will be automatically opened and closed in context of each write operation. However, recurrent openings and closings of the file might cause some performance loss. To gain the maximum performance, the file should be opened with an explicit call on this method prior to write operations. In this case, the file must also be explicitly closed with the method.

member.name: T:Juhta.Net.LibraryManagement.ConfigFileWatcher
member.summary: Defines a class that watches configuration file changes. This class raises an appropriate event every time a configuration file is created, updated or deleted in the configuration directory.

remarks.para: The implementation relies on the class. The reason why this class isn't used as such is the fact that it raises multiple events per a single file system operation causing unnecessary configuration updates to take place.

This class queues all file events caused by a single file system operation, which is done by waiting for a certain time period for all these events to occur. After that the class determines which one of the three events, , or , has actually occurred. Finally, that event will be raised for outside subscribers.

member.name: T:Juhta.Net.LibraryManagement.IClosableLibrary
member.summary: Defines an interface for closable libraries. A library is closable if it requires specific closing actions.

member.name: M:Juhta.Net.LibraryManagement.IClosableLibrary.CloseLibrary
member.summary: Closes the library, that is, performs required closing actions to release the library resources gracefully.
member.returns: Returns true if the library was closed without errors, or false if at least one error occurred in the closing process.

remarks.para: This method should not throw exceptions. It is recommended that, in case of an error, the error is logged and the closing process is continued for the rest of the closing actions. In other words, the method should close the library as completely as possible.

This method will be called even if the initialization process of the library has failed. This means that the method should prepare for such situation where the library is not initialized at all or initialized only partially.

member.name: T:Juhta.Net.LibraryManagement.IClosableLibraryState
member.summary: Defines an interface for closable library states. A library state is closable if it requires specific closing actions.

member.name: M:Juhta.Net.LibraryManagement.IClosableLibraryState.Close
member.summary: Closes the library state, that is, performs required closing actions to release the library state resources gracefully.
member.returns: Returns true if the library state was closed without errors, or false if at least one error occurred in the closing process.

remarks.para: This method should not throw exceptions. It is recommended that, in case of an error, the error is logged and the closing process is continued for the rest of the closing actions. In other words, the method should close the library state as completely as possible.

This method will be called even if the initialization process of the library state has failed. This means that the method should prepare for such situation where the library state is not initialized at all or initialized only partially.

member.name: T:Juhta.Net.LibraryManagement.IDynamicLibrary
member.summary: Defines a base interface for dynamic libraries. A dynamic library is a library whose state can be dynamically changed at the runtime e.g. by modifying the configuration of the library.

member.name: P:Juhta.Net.LibraryManagement.IDynamicLibrary.LibraryState
member.summary: Gets or sets the current state of the library.

remarks.para: The setter can assume that the specified object is initialized.

The setter is expected not to throw exceptions. The setter should be implemented by just using assignments from the properties of the specified object to the properties of the corresponding library classes. However, if the implementation of the setter contains error-prone functionality, in case of an error the setter is responsible for leaving the library in a consistent state in order to allow the process to continue running.

member.summary: Defines an interface for dynamic startable libraries. A library is a dynamic startable library if it is dynamic and contains at least one process that has to be started prior to the library's services can be used.

member.param: Specifies an object.

member.name: M:Juhta.Net.LibraryManagement.IDynamicStartableLibrary.StopProcesses(Juhta.Net.LibraryManagement.ILibraryState)
member.summary: Stops the processes in the specified library state.
member.param: Specifies an object.
member.returns: Returns true if the processes in the library state were stopped without errors, or false if at least one error occurred in the stopping process.

remarks.para: This method should not throw exceptions. It is recommended that, in case of an error, the error is logged and the stopping process is continued for the rest of the processes. In other words, the method should stop the processes as completely as possible.
This method will be called even if the method has failed. This means that the method should prepare for such situation where the processes have not been started at all or started only partially.

member.name: T:Juhta.Net.Logger
member.summary: Defines a static wrapper class for enabling easy logging through the encapsulated instance.

remarks.para: This class is also capable for serializing concurrent access to non-thread-safe instances. In other words, this class is thread-safe excluding the method.
All exceptions thrown by the underlying instance will be caught without handling, so no exceptions will be thrown by the class.
